section_text: 1 This Act may be cited for all purposes as the Debtors (Scotland) Act 1880.
2 This Act shall extend to Scotland only.

section_title: Abolition of imprisonment for debt, with certain exceptions.
section_text: 4 With the exceptions herein-after mentioned, no person shall be apprehended or imprisoned on account of any civil debt. There shall be excepted from the operation of the above enactment,—  1 Taxes, fines, or penalties due to Her Majesty, and rates and assessments lawfully imposed or to be imposed: 1 Fines imposed for contempt of court or under section 91 of the Court of Session Act 1868. 2 Sums decerned for aliment: Provided that no person shall be imprisoned in any case excepted from the operation of this section for a longer period than twelve months. Nothing contained in this Act shall affect or prevent the apprehension or imprisonment of any person under  a warrant granted against him as being in meditatione fugæ, or under any decree  or obligation ad factum præstandum.
